meanings.def: to give somebody something that they can use, or some work or responsibility
examples: assign something (to somebody) The teacher assigned a different task to each of the children.
The two large classrooms have been assigned to us.
assign somebody something We have been assigned the two large classrooms.
The teacher assigned each of the children a different task.

meanings.def: to provide a person for a particular task or position
examples: assign somebody (to something/as something) They've assigned their best man to the job.
Two senior officers have been assigned to the case.
assign somebody to do something British forces have been assigned to help with peacekeeping.

meanings.def: to send a person to work under the authority of somebody or in a particular group
examples: be assigned to somebody/something I was assigned to B platoon.
He was assigned to the Royal Canadian Navy in 1975.

meanings.def: to say that something has a particular value or function, or happens at a particular time or place
examples: assign something to something Assign a different colour to each different type of information.
assign something sth The painting cannot be assigned an exact date.

meanings.def: to say that your property or rights now belong to somebody else
examples: The agreement assigns copyright to the publisher.
She has assigned the lease to her daughter.
